author: Rakesh Reddy
V K
text:
In what appears to be a case of honour killing, the severed body parts of a youngster, allegedly murdered by his girlfriend’s parents, were found in two different places.

The case came to light when the residents next to the Nadimivanka stream found a torso floating in the stream and informed the police.

Meanwhile, the Atmakur police who had registered a missing case of Mohammed Shabbir Basha (21), a sheep herdsman of Muttala village of the mandal, were informed of the body by the Anantapur police.

When the Atmakur police brought the parents of Shabbir Basha to the Anantapur government general hospital, they identified the torso as that of their son.

The police, based on the suspicion of the deceased’s parents, went to the house of D. Chandrasekhara Reddy of Muttala village only to find him absconding. However, his wife, Shakuntala, confessed to the crime, police claimed. A post-mortem is yet to be conducted to ascertain the identity of the deceased.
title: Body of youth found, honour killing suspected
